title: New-age tech may replace banks as market leaders: Sridhar Sivaram
summary: Sridhar Sivaram from Enam Holdings suggests that consumer down-trading impacts brand loyalty, driven by shrinking disposable incomes rather than a shrinking middle class. He anticipates potential shifts in market leadership from financials to sectors like pharma, particularly CDMO, and new-age tech.
fullContent: Sridhar Sivaram from Enam Holdings suggests that consumer down-trading impacts brand loyalty, driven by shrinking disposable incomes rather than a shrinking middle class. He anticipates potential shifts in market leadership from financials to sectors like pharma, particularly CDMO, and new-age tech.

title: Russia Tsunami Live: Tsunami Warning | 8.8 Magnitude Earthquake in Russia | Weather News | Top News

title: Vedanta to announce Q1 results today. Here's what to expect
summary: Vedanta is projected to experience a sequential decrease in profitability for the April-June quarter of FY26, primarily due to declining commodity prices in its aluminium and zinc segments. Brokerages anticipate a 12-14% quarter-on-quarter drop in EBITDA, although cost reductions may partially mitigate the impact.
fullContent: Vedanta is projected to experience a sequential decrease in profitability for the April-June quarter of FY26, primarily due to declining commodity prices in its aluminium and zinc segments. Brokerages anticipate a 12-14% quarter-on-quarter drop in EBITDA, although cost reductions may partially mitigate the impact.

title: Cash Ur Drive IPO to open for subscription today. Check GMP, price band and other details
summary: Cash Ur Drive Marketing's IPO will open for subscription. The company aims to raise Rs 60.79 crore through a fresh issue and offer for sale. The IPO price band is Rs 123 to Rs 130 per share. The IPO will close on August 4. Allotment is expected on August 5.

title: Richest Thai Sees $10 Billion Hydro, LNG Projects Driving Growth

title: China's July manufacturing activity contracts more than expected — declines for fourth-straight month

title: Brigade Hotel Ventures shares to list today. GMP signals flattish debut
summary: Brigade Hotel Ventures will debut on the stock market on July 31. The IPO concluded successfully, raising Rs 759.60 crore. Grey market premiums are currently zero, suggesting a flat listing. The IPO was subscribed 4.48 times overall. The company reported a profit decline despite revenue growth. Investors will watch the stock's performance closely.
fullContent: Brigade Hotel Ventures will debut on the stock market on July 31. The IPO concluded successfully, raising Rs 759.60 crore. Grey market premiums are currently zero, suggesting a flat listing. The IPO was subscribed 4.48 times overall. The company reported a profit decline despite revenue growth. Investors will watch the stock's performance closely.

title: Conversation with Frank Fabozzi, CFA, Featuring Joanne Hill and Larry Siegel
summary: 60 Years of Ideas that Changed Investing: CFA Institute Research Foundation at Work From efficient markets and asset pricing models to factor investing, artificial intelligence, and private markets, CFA Institute Research Foundation has helped shape modern investment thinking across six decades of evolution. Its open-access content—including monographs, briefs, literature reviews, and the Financial Thought Exchange podcast—has become an essential resource for professionals seeking rigorous, practitioner-relevant insight. In this conversation, Joanne Hill and Larry Siegel—two driving forces behind the Research Foundation’s evolution—explore some of its most influential contributions to the investment profession. title: Anant Ambani's appointment to RIL board gets shareholder nod
summary: Anant Ambani is now the executive director at Reliance Industries. Reliance Industries shareholders gave their approval. The RIL board appointed Mukesh Ambani's youngest son on April 25. Anant will serve for five years, starting May 1. He has been on the boards of Jio Platforms and Reliance Foundation. He also serves on Reliance New Energy and Reliance New Solar Energy.

title: Will Tata Motors' ambitious Iveco acquisition strain its financial stability?
summary: Tata Motors' stock experienced a decline following reports of a possible acquisition of Iveco. The deal, valued at ₹3.9 billion, may require external funding for the Indian automaker. title: Thursday: Unemployment Claims, Personal Income and Outlays
summary: Note: Mortgage rates are from MortgageNewsDaily.com and are for top tier scenarios. Thursday: • At 8:30 AM ET, The initial weekly unemployment claims report will be released. The consensus is for initial claims to increase to 230 thousand from 221 thousand last week. • Also at 8:30 AM, Personal Income and Outlays, June 2025. The consensus is for a 0.3% increase in personal income, and for a 0.4% increase in personal spending. And for the Core PCE price index to increase 0.3%.  PCE prices are expected to be up 2.5% YoY, and core PCE prices up 2.7% YoY. • At 9:45 AM, Chicago Purchasing Managers Index for July.

title: Vedanta Resources seeks investor nod to prepay $550-million debt
summary: Vedanta Resources aims to prepay a $550 million private credit facility by raising $700 million from banks like Barclays and Standard Chartered, seeking investor consent for early repayment. This refinancing targets a lower interest rate, around SOFR + 400-500 basis points, significantly reducing borrowing costs.

This refinancing targets a lower interest rate, around SOFR + 400-500 basis points, significantly reducing borrowing costs.

title: Spandana's top ten investors to buy into Rs 400-crore rights issue
summary: Spandana Sphoorty Financial's ₹400-crore rights issue, opening August 1, has secured participation from its top 10 institutional investors, including Kedaara Capital, which holds 48.13%. Despite a net loss in FY25, the company aims to restore stakeholder confidence through this issue. Kedaara Capital may extend its investment beyond its scheduled exit in September 2026.

title: How will Trump's tariff announcement impact Indian stock market?

title: Why did Fed keep interest rates unchanged despite Trump's pressure?
summary: The Federal Reserve maintained its key short-term interest rate, defying President Trump's persistent calls for a reduction. The rate remains at 4.3%, a level established after three cuts last year, with officials citing the need to assess the impact of Trump's tariffs on inflation and the economy.
